It's such a shame about today, sir.
I swear I almost hit it.
Sir, why don't we go around to check out the other side?
One of my managers got into some trouble and has been arrested by the police.
For something personal. It has nothing to do with the club.
I think our chatrooms have been exposed to the police.
they must've figured out how much we charge per table,
so we'll have to declare our real income, sir.
we'll just have to raise the price.
-One, two, three! Rock, paper, scissors! -One, two, three! Rock, paper, scissors!
You can reserve a table now.
I'll make sure you have fun…
There are quite a few unpaid bills lately.
By the guests or by the managers?
You gambled with the boys, didn't you?
When did you become a manager?
And you have this many unpaid bills?
A customer changed her number and ghosted us.
And the hosts don't know anything?
Even if we find them, I doubt they have any money.
It's two women, who came in at times with their salary.
{\an8}They always paid with several credit cards.
{\an8}knowing they were going to ghost us?
{\an8}-Did you call me, sir? -Call Ssaebi over.
{\an8}Ssaebi's gone to Busan today to collect money, sir.
{\an8}You took a picture of their IDs, right?
{\an8}-Pay up, come on. -Just not my day.
{\an8}Tell me everything you know about her.
{\an8}Well, I changed my name, you know.
And I don't think he likes that name very much.
It doesn't have "bin" in it, does it?
She slips into a really strong dialect when she's drunk.
The one that came with that big girl?
Girls who are afraid of others finding out always come with the same friends.
Didn't she say she works at a dermatology clinic?
Right. A department store in Myeong-dong, sir.
I'll show you how I became a manager in just two weeks and the boss in a year.
Can't you see her? To your right, 1 o'clock.
You over there, who drank at a host bar and ran off without paying!
Did you enjoy drinking with those pretty men for free?
Give my money back, you bitch!
Your mom's here! Time to go home.
How dare you bring our baby here?
Let go! Let go of me, woman! Let go!
-What the hell's wrong with you, woman? -What?
-Can't I drink in this kind of place? -What makes you think you can?
Where did we put the jacket?
I'm the head of the household!
Here's your jacket. Let's get you home.
I think it's dinner if you eat before you go to bed,
and breakfast if you do after you wake up.
The new cook's food is very good.
Have you ever seen a baby?
a baby came to the club.
It must have felt as if a bird flew in.
She said you seemed to like sweet potato stems.
What do you want to do?
I want to be in a really good mood,
but I have no idea what I should do.
So I'll let you do what you want to do.
Is there anything you wish to happen today?
Is there anything like that? Yeom Mi-jeong!
SOMETHING GOOD WILL HAPPEN TO YOU TODAY
I took a look at what you submitted to apply for a permanent position.
do you think it can be included in your portfolio?
You can't honestly say you did it on your own.
You can't take credit for it. Don't you think?
I attached it because I was asked to submit everything I've worked on here.
And since I also attached the new design plan,
I think it shows quite clearly
how much my work contributed to the design.
Then tell me. How much did your work contribute to the design?
The least he could do is help.
He's terrified you might become a permanent employee. Bastard.
He's afraid that you might win the contest.
I'm jealous of your permanent position,
but to think you'll have to keep seeing him…
So what will you do? You'll have to see him every day.
Who do you think will last longer here?
Mr. Choi is having an affair.
God, I feel so cold and lonely.
Use the feelings you saved in summer.
Remember how we stored them up when it was super hot?
I'll use them when it gets colder.
She wanted us to ask Mr. Gu what she should do with the house.
He already paid rent for a year,
so she wants us to ask whether she should leave it empty or if she can rent it out.
Why did he leave in such a hurry without telling his landlady?
It seems he's changed his number.
But you're still in touch, right?
I go out for a walk at night thinking,
"I don't care if I die tonight."
What's the big deal about some guy leaving?
He ran because he was afraid of being happy.
Bring it on, you damn mutt.
Do you know how many sausages I've given you?
I want to bleed like a fountain.
"So that's what is in my head."
When they first told me it was cancer,
I thought, "Right, I haven't taken care of my health. I should get it together."
And when I relapsed, my first thought was, "Don't let Hyeon-a go."
"It's going to be tough this time. I need her."
Even if I'm going to hell,
I don't think I'll be afraid as long as you and Hyeon-a are there.
I guess I know why people used to be buried alive.
Even emperors who ruled over everything were afraid.
Why do I have to follow you there?
The whole time I was with Hyeon-a,
it felt like I was in a relationship with you, too.
When I hadn't even met you once.
She talked about you all the time.
Who likes hearing his girl go on about some other guy?
Though she kept denying that there was anything between you.
You might not feel anything for her, but I'm sure she does.
I'm excited, imagining us all going to hell together.
I said I'm not going! I'm not following you there.
-Are you nuts? -I'm free to dream, aren't I?
We'd have fun together even in hell.
Why do you drag me into this? We're not that close.
Why do you think it's about us?
so I haven't lost much hair.
Is your hair your biggest concern right now?
You're worried your dad will scold you, in front of a cancer patient?
It's not that big a deal.
Looks like you partied hard tonight, too.
Take the glitter off your face at least.
Let's talk to him after we're done.
I don't know anymore. I'll be dead meat later.
I'd think, "Maybe after the summer vacation."
"I'll be lonely at the end of the year."
"And working isn't so bad in spring."
And another year would go by.
I'm not like A-reum, a greedy workaholic whose only goal is making money.
This isn't the right path for me.
I don't have to force myself to keep walking on it.
You don't need to explain yourself to me.
I don't have a specific goal in my life.
Can't I just live my life without one?
I can't force myself to live for something I don't really desire.
I wish I had an older brother.
Then I would be able to live as I wished.
He's worked at that company for eight years. That's enough.
It's hard to get a job somewhere else after you turn 40.
The younger you are, the better.
Young people these days move from one job to another really often.
Staying at the same job for long isn't considered a virtue anymore.
How do you know what suits you better? You have to try different workplaces.
I'm not going to do anything for a little while.
How long is a little while?
Can't you treat me even half as well as you treated Gu?
if you hadn't seen him in a while. "Is he sick? Did he eat?" But to me…
I know I'm not a perfect son or anything.
But I haven't done anything I'm ashamed of.
There are so many bad people out there,
but I've never done anything to be an embarrassment to you.
The thing I brought home the other day. I said it was from the company,
but it was from the store owners who heard I was quitting.
There are even people who promised to gift me 500,000 won when I get married.
But do you think they were all nice from the beginning?
No, I had to work really hard!
You work with machines. You don't have to talk to anyone,
so you have no idea what it's like to work with people.
But I still never lost my temper or got myself into trouble.
They even gave me gifts. That should be enough!
It's not like I'm going to idle away for the rest of my life!
What's that? Hey, wait. Stay there.
Hey, take a picture of us.
-Sweet potatoes keep coming out. -They grew so well.
It's right next to ours. Why did theirs grow so poorly?
Just because you farmed for long doesn't mean you're good at it.
You need to learn the know-how.
These days, it's easy to learn things
-Dad, this is seriously awesome. -There's more here. Good.
We almost caught up with them, Dad!
Are the sweet potatoes really the priority right now?
-I can't believe it, you brat! -Stop, Mom.
Poor me, I have to cook even after crashing into a rice paddy.
whether or not you hire someone for the factory.
Tending the crops that grow like crazy,
God, I can't do it anymore.
You just eat, put down your spoon,
and go back out to the field or the factory.
But I have to follow you around
coming in and out of the house dozens of times to cook for you.
And it's not like I have any days off.
I had a day off when we used to go to church.
But you couldn't even let me have that and stopped going.
I'm going to start attending church again!
Why am I sweating so much?
I think I'll be a bit late today.
Then I'll go first and wait for you.
I think I'll be done quite late.
If it gets too late, I can just go home.
Don't worry about me and focus on your work. Bye.
On days like this, just go home early!
You'll fall sick, dating that hard.
How can you go and see him every single day?
and my dad got a girlfriend…
What would that lady have to do for me to like her?
I'd hate it if she tried hard to get close to me,
and I'd hate it if she treated me like a thorn in her side, too.
if she were a selfless, independent woman.
So today, I tried to look like a selfless, independent woman,
but all those words I said to make you accept me
didn't seem to work at all.
Why are you here every day?
Do we owe you money or something?
Think carefully. It's not easy to raise someone else's kid.
Even raising my own kids drives me up the wall.
That's because they're your own kids.
Do you know how much you can hate someone else's kid?
I didn't say we're getting married! We're just dating!
Once you get attached, that's it.
I should have cut him off then and there.
He would've found someone else to marry.
Why did I feel sorry for him when he looked so down?
I'll just stop by and take a look.
I'll be able to tell if he's the one for you.
I can just walk past and take a quick look.
This place used to be really small. It seems they've expanded it.
We used to come here a lot when I was living with my aunt.
I heard the sujebi here is really good.
I'm reminded of how I used to have them when I was little.
Plus, octopus is pretty healthy, I hear.
I still have the memories of eating here when I was little.
I ordered a seafood pancake for you, okay?
Shall I order something else, too?
Damn it, she was supposed to act like she didn't know me.
Long time no see! Did you go somewhere today?
I heard you're selling your field.
Yes. Gosh, I can't do it anymore.
Of course not, at your age.
You've got the factory and the chores at home.
If you marry a workaholic, it's the woman who suffers.
When have we ever had a dog?
A while ago, I saw Mi-jeong crying her eyes out,
and when I asked her what was wrong, she said she lost her dog.
It was about a month ago.
If it wasn't a dog, what was it? A goat?
Your percentage has gone up even more.
Yeom Mi-jeong is moving in for the final blow.
YEOM MI-JEONG: WHY ARE YOU TAKING SO LONG?
YEOM MI-JEONG: I'VE BEEN WAITING SO LONG
Ms. Contest Winner, are you heading home?
You're the winner, so you can party super-duper hard,
and I'm the runner-up, so just super hard.
What do you want to do?
Is there anything you wish to happen today?
-Why does she always turn us down? -Why not?
I want you to come to me.
SOMETHING GOOD WILL HAPPEN TO YOU TODAY
SOMETHING GOOD WILL HAPPEN TO YOU TODAY
Is this not Yeom Je-ho's house?
Gosh, I'm going to cry at this rate. Goodness me.
She went into the bedroom to lie down for a bit
Even when you don't know how you'll go on,
you can still find things that are bearable.
The kids went through a lot.
have all gone to live in Seoul.
I don't even care if we're family. I won't see you again!
So now, she would be blameless if she decided to move out.
Is this Yeom Mi-jeong? This is Choi Jun-ho's wife.
I knew he was having an affair. And with whom.
Why are you ignoring me after proposing to me?
Where are you now? How are you doing?
How could she not know the name of the person she dated?
I thought you'd be able to if you really wanted to.
Why does it feel like it's like you?
